title: Earth Pledge by Oberon Zell-Ravenheart in conclusion to his personal affirmation of awareness (11 May 1972)

coauthors.name: Oberon Zell-Ravenheart
coauthors.bio: Oberon Zell-Ravenheart (also: Timothy Zell, 1942-), born in St. Louis, Missouri, is a Neopagan writer, speaker and religious leader. He is the co-founder of the Church of All Worlds.

content:
“I am aware of Goddess as the essential manifestation of not-yet-consciousness of the single vast Living Creature known as Terrebios: the Biosphere and planetary body of the Planet Earth, who has been conceptualized intuitively and correctly by all men from time immemorial as Mother Earth; Mother Nature. I am further aware that, as a cell in the vast body of Terrebios, I share in this essential Divinity, as do all other living beings, and I express this awareness of immanent Divinity the phrase, ‘Thou art God.'[1] In Hebrew: אתה אלהים (atah Elohim). The complete phrase in Psalms 86:10 is atah Elohim livadekha (“You alone are Elohim”), where Elohim is a divine name often translated as “God” or “Deity.” The use of this portion of Psalms 86:10 has a particular usage in Stranger in a Strange Land (1961) a science fiction novel by Robert A. Heinlein, of import to Tim Zell’s theology. Atah Elohim livadekha is found in Jewish liturgy and, adapted, is invoked as atah Elohim emet (“You are truly Elohim”). The term also has application in Jewish panentheism. –Aharon Varady 

I am of the opinion that the evolution of consciousness in the maturation of Terrebios is such that mankind will eventually develop a telepathic breakthrough to the extent that we come to share in a single global consciousness, which will be the awakening and birth into consciousness of our planet, of Goddess.[2] The association of the manifest and immanent world with the Shekhinah (the divine dwelling/presence, understood in gendered feminine Hebew) is a familiar principle of Ḳaballah. –ANV  I am also of the opinion that this emerging consciousness will continue to evolve and spread throughout the galaxy, perhaps the universe, as an increasingly omnipotent and omniscient Divinity, inevitably coming into contact also with other such emerging Deities originating with other planets.

It is my firm conviction that continually evolving unfoldment of limitless potential is the only ‘purpose’ of life, whether the life of a man, a snake, a tree, or a planet, and the only absolute duty of man is thus to become what he potentially is.[3] Cf. the “Human Potential Movement” (wikipedia)  It is also my conviction that realization of all of these things implies a certain ethical standard, incorporating respect for all other life forms, a commitment to ecological harmony on the macrocosmic scale and self-actualization on the microcosmic scale, and the diligent application of life-affirming values in all my dealings with my fellow Beings.” (19 Ruis/AA10)

Contribute a translation Source (English)
I pledge allegiance to the Earth,
To the Planet on which I stand;
One Living Biosphere, indivisible,
With freedom and responsibility for all!

This earth pledge can be found in the Church of All Worlds’s newsletter, Green Egg, vol. 5, issue 47 (11 May 1972), p. 28. The quote, appearing after a line break of asterisks, concludes an essay by the newsletter’s editor, Tim Zell (a/k/a Oberon Zell-Ravenheart), entitled “personal affirmation of awareness.” It is the earliest earth pledge I have yet located (!) and may be the veritable inspiration of all that followed. –Aharon Varady
